message.content:
Here is a step-by-step explanation in markdown format for how you can solve this problem using Python code. 

```python
# Define the initial variables
initial_pairs = 10
final_pairs = 7
hours_passed = 10
weather = "same weather conditions" # assuming same weather conditions

# Calculate the time it takes to dry one pair of socks
time_per_pair = hours_passed / (initial_pairs - final_pairs) 

# Calculate the time it will take for Tom to dry seven pairs of socks
total_hours = time_per_pair * final_pairs
```
In this code, we first define our initial variables. We then calculate how long it takes to dry one pair of socks by dividing the total hours passed (10) by the difference between the number of pairs before and after they were washed (`initial_pairs - final_pairs = 7`). Finally, we multiply this time per pair by the number of pairs that Tom wants to have dry (final_pairs=7), giving us our total hours.
